training: You will now play a few practice rounds.
instructions:
You will now see the instructions for the next game.
You can press RIGHT to see the next instructions.
You can press LEFT to see the previous instructions.
instructions_perm: Press LEFT for the previous, RIGHT for the next instructions.
instructions_end: To start the game press LEFT. If you want to see the previous screen press RIGHT.

hcp.0.0:
This is a game of chance.
Think of it as drawing cards from a deck.
The cards have numbers from one to nine.
First, you will see a question mark on the screen and you make a guess, then the card will be presented.
You must guess whether the number is LESS than or GREATER than five.
hcp.0.1:
Press LEFT to guess that the number is LESS than five.
Press RIGHT to guess that the number will be GREATER than five.
You must answer while the question mark is on the screen.
hcp.1.0: After you answer, the card will be shown.
hcp.1.1:
If you guessed correctly,
a green arrow appears in the fixation cross and you WIN 1 point.
hcp.1.2: If not, a red arrow will appear and you LOSE 0.5 points.
hcp.1.3: If the result is five, the fixation cross turns yellow and you gain nothing.
hcp.1.4: After each round, we shuffle the deck.
hcp.2.0:
Remember:
Press LEFT to guess the number is LESS less than five.
Press RIGHT to guess the number is GREATER than five.

gonogo.0.0:
In this game, you have to figure out whether it's better to press LEFT or to not to press the LEFT.
There are some situations where it's better to press or not to press the LEFT.
In some situations you can WIN points, in other you can LOSE points.
gonogo.0.1:
Each situation is introduced by one of four images.
You have to learn from experience whether it is better to press or not for each image.
gonogo.1.0: In each trial, you will see an image that introduces the situation:
gonogo.3.0:
When the fixation cross turns white you have to decide:
Do you press LEFT or NOT?
gonogo.4.0: After a while you will get feedback if you made the right decision or not.
gonogo.5.0:
Remember:
When the cross flashes white you have to decide!
Do you press LEFT or NOT?

two-step.0.0:
In this game you will make a series of choices.
First, you will be given two images to choose from.
Your choice will take you to the second level.
two-step.1.0: Your first choice will lead to another choice between two images. The images you see will depend on your first choice.
two-step.1.1: Choosing an image in the second stage will sometimes earn you points and sometimes not. Some images are better than others, but which ones are better changes slowly during the experiment.
two-step.2.0: The structure of the game is as follows:
two-step.2.1: Each first-level choice has a 'preferred' second level. For example, if you choose the image with the cross, you'll usually see the blue (left) images, but sometimes you'll see the yellow images instead.
two-step.2.2: This preference stays the same throughout the game.
two-step.3.0:
Remember:
In each trial you will have to make two choices.
Press LEFT to select the image on the left.
Press RIGHT to select the image on the right.

mid.0.0: In this game you will play with three shapes:
mid.0.1:
The yellow squares mean you play to NOT LOSE points.
The pink circles mean you play to WIN points.
The triangle means nothing is at stake.
mid.1.0:
The first thing that will happen in the game is one of these shapes will come up.
All you have to do is read the shapes to see if you play to WIN, to LOSE or if nothing is at stake.
After the shape you will see a fixation cross.
When you see the cross, you should just wait.
mid.2.0:
After the fixation there will always be a black shape that is the same shape as the one you just saw.
Your job is to press LEFT when you see a black shape.
mid.2.1: If you press to soon or do not press when the black shape is up, you will not receive the outcome for that shape.
mid.3.0:
Remember:

When you see a pink circle, you can WIN points.

When you see a yellow square, you can LOSE points.

When you see a blue triangle, there is nothing at stake.

Press LEFT when you see the black shape to WIN or NOT LOSE.

posner.0.0:
In this game, you must respond to a target stimulus that briefly appears on either the left or the right side of the fixation cross.
To gain points, you must indicate the side on which the target appeared by pressing either LEFT or RIGHT.
posner.1.0:
Before the target appears, an arrow will appear on either the left or the right side of the fixation cross.
The location arrow can help you predict, the side where the target will appear.
This game can be difficult, so pay attention to the cue.
posner.2.0:
After the cue, the target will appear, on either left or right side and a distractor will appear on the opposite side. The target is a diamond, with the top or bottom corner is cut off.
Press LEFT to indicate that the target appeared on the left.
Press RIGHT to indicate that the target appeared on the right.
posner.3.0:
Please try to focus on the fixation cross in the center of the screen for the entire game.
Try not to move your eyes to the target stimulus.
posner.4.0:
Remember:
Press LEFT to indicate that the target appeared on the left.
Press RIGHT to indicate that the target appeared on the right.

Please respond as quickly and accurately as possible!

risk-sensitive.0.0:
In this game you will see five different images and choose between them.
Each image has a different value. Some images will always give you the same amount of points, some images will give you points with a 50% probability.
risk-sensitive.1.0: In the game you will sometimes see a single image on the left or the right side of the screen. You must select this image. Pressing LEFT if it is on the left and RIGHT if it is on the right.
risk-sensitive.1.1: These trials will help you to figure out the meaning of each image.
risk-sensitive.2.0:
In other trials you have to decide between two images.
Choose in a way, that will earn you the most points.
Press LEFT to select the image on the left.
Press RIGHT to select the image on the right.
risk-sensitive.3.0:
Remember:
Press LEFT to select the image on the left.
Press RIGHT to select the image on the right.
